title: Exploring Shapes and Area
learning_points: A square is a special type of rectangle where all sides are equal.
The area of a square can be found by multiplying its side length by itself.
To find the area of a rectangle, multiply its length by its width.
A triangle is half of a rectangle, so its area can be calculated as half the product of its base and height.
Pentomino puzzles help us understand how different shapes can cover the same area, similar to comparing footprints or stamps.
Rectangles can be tiled using smaller squares without any gaps or overlaps.
baseline_assessment: Is a square a type of rectangle? Yes
Can you find the area of a square if you know its side length? Yes
Do triangles have the same area as rectangles? No
Can you use pentominoes to show that different shapes can cover the same area? Yes
Are rectangles and squares always the same size? No
